sentence.Network_en: Mr. Bumble tasted the medicine with a doubtful look.
sentence.Network_cn: 班布尔先生带着疑惑的表情尝了尝这种药.

sentence.Network_en: Mr. Bumble's conduct , on being left to himself, was rather inexplicable.
sentence.Network_cn: 班布尔先生独自留下时的举动实在令人费解.

sentence.Network_en: Mr Bumble tapped with his cane on the counter several times.
sentence.Network_cn: 班布尔先生用他的藤杖轻轻敲了几下柜台.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English  (in the sense 'hum, drone'): from boom + -le

means.word_mean: 1. make a mess of, destroy or ruin;

sentences.sentence: "I botched the dinner and we had to eat out"
"the pianist screwed up the difficult passage in the second movement"
"The speaker faltered when he saw his opponent enter the room"

means.word_mean: 杂乱无章地说；结结巴巴地说

sentences.cn: 他结结巴巴地讲完了他的演说。

sentences.en: He kept bumbling on about something.
sentences.cn: 他结结巴巴地说个不停。

sentences.en: I don’t know what he has done, he just bumbles through life.
sentences.cn: 我不知道他做了些什么事，他简直是在混日子。

means.word_mean: 笨手笨脚地走动；(在…)跌跌撞撞

sentences.en: I could hear my father bumbling about downstairs.
sentences.cn: 我听见父亲在楼下跌跌撞撞地走着。

sentences.en: a film of two sisters bumbling around their home, making tea
sentences.cn: 一部关于两姐妹满屋子瞎折腾着泡茶的电影
